snippet: The report, issued by a grand jury, recommended changes to the property tax system, including civil sanctions and stiffer penalties for landlords who file false documents.
abstract: Grand jury report issues an unusual report, recommending a series of 'desperately needed' changes to New York City's property tax system, including civil sanctions and stiffer penalties for landlords who file false documents and information; jury, which issued report after handing down indictments in three cases, suggests property tax evasion may be widespread in the city.
lead_paragraph: The report, issued by a grand jury, recommended changes to the property tax system, including civil sanctions and stiffer penalties for landlords who file false documents.
